OOC: First of all. I am not code. Got it? GOT IT? I will never be, code. Yo=
u will address me properly or I'll call you ma'am. Second, Everyone were ex=
cited to go to Cybertron in the RPG, and I actually allowed them to think f=
or themselves, and construct Cybertron the way they wanted. Well, nobody co=
uld, because Cybertron isn't as easy to imagine as Earth...

  ----- Origin=
al Message ----- 
  From: Legendarynemasis@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroup=
s.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, November 21, 2001 3:41 PM
  Subject: Re: Debate (=
important everyone read)


         You may have kept the people from going=
 off Cybertron code, which would be unrealistic for Cybertrons. If we could=
 expand the RPG past one singular world then that would create excitement a=
nd people would post more often as there would be more to do. Storys could =
bloom and develop as charachter can interact with new things. Rather then e=
veryone just fighting each other all the time and being fenced in.
